author: mgreenegit
body:
This can be observed by testing the GPRegistryPolicyParser module using PowerShell 7.1. When Get-Content is called to read files exported from Group Policy using Backup-GPO, a warning is written that 'byte' is not a valid input for -encoding parameter. However, it does not seem that the module is functionally impacted. It still does what it is intended to do, other than returning the error.

Could someone from PowerShell advise the best approach for the issue in the other repo? If 'byte' is no longer available, should we remove the -encoding parameter, or use some other value?

https://github.com/PowerShell/GPRegistryPolicyParser/issues/6

comments.author: SeeminglyScience
comments.body:
> Could someone from PowerShell advise the best approach for the issue in the other repo? If 'byte' is no longer available, should we remove the -encoding parameter, or use some other value?

Use the `-AsByteStream` switch parameter.

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
@mgreenegit, here's the story behind this breaking change, which was made in v6: #7986

The [conclusion](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/7986#issuecomment-436816082) by @SteveL-MSFT  was: 

 > At this time, without additional customer feedback, it seems that the number of hits in the corpus based on the size of the corpus doesn't justify spending effort to add this back.

It certainly was an unfortunate change that people keep running into.

If you feel strongly enough about revisiting this, I encourage you to create a _new_ issue of type "Feature Request/Idea" and to make the case that `-Encoding Byte` should be brought back (alongside `-AsByteStream`, as an effective alias).

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

comments.author: mgreenegit
comments.body: It looks like -asbytestream is going to work for parsing .pol files

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
@mgreenegit, yes, `-AsByteStream` in PowerShell Core is the equivalent of `-Encoding Byte` in Windows PowerShell.

Leaving aside that this change isn't obvious, the bigger concern is that if you write code that targets _both_ editions, you must explicitly account for this difference, which is a nuisance.

title: Get-Content does not support -encoding 'byte'
